Articles.Content:
Hi All, What the heck is the travel Itinerary its not marked on the map??????![:huh:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_undecided.gif)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-18T00:57:20Z" title="05/18/2015 12:57  AM" data-short="9 yr">May 18, 2015</time> by Gent Harris**
Because anywhere suffices, as long as you're in the right orbit around the right planet/moon.

The Itinerary is simply the list of the flights that customer wants. So an example itinerary might be:

1) Suborbital flight on Kerbin

2) Orbit Kerbin

It does not specify anything but see the sights on Kerbin and sub orbital flight???

- - - Updated - - -

What altitude is concidered sub orbital??

>What altitude is concidered sub orbital??

Ap>70km Pe<70km (below surface is fine) on Kerbin, and probably you need current altitude>70km as well but not so sure - not doing that for a while.

Easiest way is just shoot straight up until reach >70km.
Also, the tourist contracts require suborbital to be suborbital "spaceflight", and won't register until you actually reach space.
